activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#9848
activity.text: This is the mobile view of the Medication Advice form. When the user adds a new form, any existing entries should automatically collapse. Users can manually expand or collapse entries to edit the medication details. Only one form can remain expanded at a time on the mobile screen.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#9782
activity.text: Plots tab cards are broken. We can switch to a single-column layout for smaller screens.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#9782
activity.text: The alignment and spacing on the profile card need to be fixed. Consider reducing the avatar size for smaller screens.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#9748
activity.text: The facility type will remain an independent filter, while there will be a single ‘Filter by Location’ dropdown. This dropdown will first list districts, and upon selecting a district, the ‘Local Body’ dropdown will appear.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#9504
ohcnetwork/care_fe#9343
activity.text:
I suggest using a two-column layout and showing only a limited amount of text on each card. Adding Markdown support would help users format headers and make notices easier to read.

Each notice should have a header for better clarity. If the text is too long, we can truncate it and add a button to open a modal to view the full text. This will keep the layout clean and organised, even for longer notices.
https://www.figma.com/design/Z93EYKSa1MdBmXndsMBJSQ/Care?node-id=5079-4131
![Notice Board](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/52324f25-bc5e-4b16-b293-a17507e56399)
![Notice Board Modal](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/198ee0ee-15e3-4ad4-a524-555f54838878)

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#9076
activity.text:
![Users - Availability](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3e52b3df-e6df-4783-be4e-daf400c7258f)
@rithviknishad 
Here’s a screenshot of the Availability tab within the User Details page. For Admins, this tab can be accessed via the Users list. For doctors, could we add a direct 'Schedule' link in the sidebar that redirects them to the Availability tab in their user profile? Otherwise, if a doctor needs to set their own schedule, they’d have to navigate through their profile to find the Availability tab, which may be tedious.

[Figma link](https://www.figma.com/design/Z93EYKSa1MdBmXndsMBJSQ/Care?node-id=1081-1690)

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8856
activity.text: The alert and information labels should be integrated directly into the patient card. There is no need for an additional "Create Consultation" warning alert. Placing multiple primary CTAs across the page may confuse the user, so a single, clearly defined primary CTA should be used.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8856
activity.text:
![Patient-Encounters](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3d5777bb-26d3-40a3-a375-0272847fd008)

The right sticky panel should be retitled "Actions" and display only patient-specific actions. All other links should be organised as tabs. There should be a single **primary call-to-action** on to patient card based on the user’s role. For example, for doctors, the CTA should be "Start Consultation", and for front desk staff, it should be "Book Appointment".

What do you think @bodhish ?

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8878
ohcnetwork/care_fe#8856
activity.text: > * [ ] Not a fan of the right side, we its now a mix of actions and pages so it should probably be refactored to just action. @vinutv will share the design in few days. **Here is the updated design:** https://www.figma.com/design/Z93EYKSa1MdBmXndsMBJSQ/Care?node-id=905-901 - Redesigned the patient demography section into a 3-column layout to optimise space on the page. - Placed navigation links for demography sections in the left column. These links can be hidden on smaller screens for better responsiveness. - Displayed the demography details in the center column. - Added quick links in the right column for easy access. cc @bodhish @Mahendar0701

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8834
activity.text: Typed "/" and selected "Phone Number," but the phone number field didn't get focused. It should focus on the phone number input to make it typable when the search type is selected. However, the focus remains on the search button.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8834
activity.text: The error message is hidden under the search buttons.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8834
activity.text: It's great that shortcut keys are available to access the search type from the dropdown. The dropdown should also be navigable using the up and down arrow keys on the keyboard.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8789
activity.text:
> * [ ]  Currently, when the user clicks to open the profile dropdown and then attempts to access the "Asset" tab, the dropdown closes on the initial click, and the "Asset" tab only opens after a subsequent click. The expected behavior is that upon clicking the "Asset" tab, the profile dropdown should automatically close, and the "Asset" tab should open in a single action.

@nihal467 
Yes, The ideal interaction behaviour is for the new link to open even when the dropdown is still active. 
Could we address this as a separate issue?
